Corey,

Welcome!  I would recommend starting off with something small, perh=
aps like
https://github.com/KentBeck/junit/issues/144.  More than half of t=
he effort
for first-time contributors tends to be caught up in code formatt=
ing,
GitHub wrangling, and getting used to the "team" structure.  Best to g=
et
that under your belt after just a couple dozen new lines of code.  Some
=
earnest contributors start with a thousand-line patch, only to get
frustrat=
ed before we can work together to massage it into something
pullable.

Than=
ks for checking in here!

   David
